intro: Bilabrella galpinii, commonly known as the Galpin's bilabrella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
